title: Still bitter about the Veigar rework...
body:
As a previous Veigar main, I was just thinking about how it's been ages since I last bothered playing as him and that it has been even longer since I've seen a Veigar in game.  I remember people arguing that he was actually better post rework because he can farm more safely & efficient but from what I can tell that's rubbish.  

Anyone else still feeling the sting from the Veigar rework?  I miss everything about playing him, he great lines, that laugh, his play but it is so frustrating pretending his stun is in any way reliable.

 - Veigar is dead.  Long live Veigar. -

replies.body:
I just wish he would be as strong as he was before "compensation", but to say that he is any better than he was before is just lying.

I don't find him fun to play anymore, I don't find him reliable, and I can't think of any comp where he fits better than other bursty TF oriented mages.

True, he is no longer the piece of trash 38% win-rate 0.00001% pick-rate patch 5.4 made him, but the popularity loss definitely shows how successful his rework really was, and it seems the door is officially closed for more buffs for a long time. 

I don't even want him to be next to Zed and Katarina above 50% ban rate and picked in 1/3 games. All I wanted was for him to still be a niche pick: underrated but very powerful. Now he is a nearly instant lost lane with a horrible pick rate, whose popularity is below Urgot's and whose ban rate is nearly 0%.

I've been playing him a lot lately. He seems pretty decent. He has some matchups that used to be skill matchups that are now just bad, like Yasuo or Zed. For the most part though I haven't been having any problems with him, and once you get to midgame with reasonable farm blowing people up with 2 spells is a ton of fun.

The problem is with the same farm he could reasonably take two people out of a fight without dying. Now he is high risk to take out one person. New veigar is basically outclassed at everything he wants to do by another mage. Want the zone control, Viktor and Oriana do it better. Want to take out a single target, LeBlanc and Syndra do it better. Want to farm for a stupid late game power threat, Cassiopeia does it better.

he is so becuase his stun move has a delay now

Sure he isnt weak, but Riot just buffed his numbers to a point where he just cant have <50% win rate... 
But some Number-Buffs cant hide the fact that his playstyle is horrible! Riot took a large shovel and put every single strength he had into the farming Part of his Q. 

Additinal: Is "you can now stack 2 minions with one Q" and some CD and mana tweeks, really an excuse for :
- removed DFG
- making his Q less reliable
- making his E less reliable
- making his R weaker
.. i dont think so.

The range he can farm from is way higher now, making him significantly safer against jungle ganks and gap closing mid laners than he ever was before. The ability to both poke and farm with Q in the same cast is pretty significant. There are more advantages to Q being a skillshot than disadvantages.

When you catch a team in your stun, or another person's CC, your new Q allows you to burst 2 targets, or a squishy behind a tanky target without having to get to close.

His W hit's harder than most ultimates in the game, It absolutely should not be more reliable. A weaker and more reliable W wouldn't be any fun. Half the fun of Veigar is getting to that late game where Q-W can just blow up a squishy ADC all on their own from full health.

I can tolerate the E delay by itself, but I despise the fact that Veigar's W is still reliant on it.
Dark Matter should be changed so that it can be used effectively by itself (without CC— ex: larger AOE, shorter delay, etc.), or it should be reworked entirely.

I still seeing vieger carry games, people learned to adapt and make him good.

He was a low skill cap, low counterplay, extremely high damage mage that needed a rework. Otherwise, he would never see a buff again and every time he started looking strong, he would get nerfed. 

I do feel the Veigar rework has a minor problem and it is his Event Horizon visual delay. I feel the delay should remain the same between casting and it taking effect, but I feel the visual for the opponent should be reduced slightly. Much like Cho Gath's Rupture, where there is a delay between the cast and the visual appearing. 

This would require Veigar to still be more calculated about how he wanted to use Event Horizon, but makes it a bit less easy to escape with mobile champions.
